fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9996].
  {panel}

Now an issue is open (no resolution) or closed (a resolution) this is also shown in the form of a green color or a red color.
A lot of the time issues are somewhere in between these two.
fi: Waiting for a meeting, On hold (because there blocked by something else, ...)
For these issues I would like a third option let's say color orange issues that are on Hold.

? Also needed for this ?
This means one or 2 extra workflow steps (Waiting for a meeting and on Hold)
Extra statusses Waiting for a meeting and On Hold.
fields.summary: Allow to specify colour for statuses and resolutions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9979].
  {panel}

Currently the support system has 486k notificationinstances in JIRA's support system.  There is no way currently to clean them up easily.

If we can add a 'created' column to the notificationinstance table, then we can periodically remove ones that aren't relevant anymore.

For the old ones, can we have an upgrade task that sets the created date to be either the date of upgrade, or the date of update of the issue?

h3. Notes

Please refer to [Preparing for JIRA 5.2|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+5.2] for a thorough explanation about how the changes within this improvement request affect JIRA and the way it now handles mail.
fields.summary: NotificationInstance's should have a creation date, and a service to clean them up
Preserve the text style when switching from Default Text Renderer to Wiki Style Renderer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9976].
  {panel}

Investigate the behaviour of Windows Outlook editor in replying to JIRA HTML emails.

* Reported that comments are all placed on one line when Outlook editor is configured to not use Word. 
* Further, using Outlook as the editor, if there are no blank lines between the text and the original text (or the horizontal rule), JIRA will eat the comment. Since all the text is on the same line because there are no line breaks, it strips the entire message, thinking it is the original message.
* When Word is used, extra spaces are added inbetween lines.
fields.summary: Investigate Outlook editor behaviour in replying to JIRA HTML emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9960].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 4 March 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request. While this feature is something we want to add to JIRA, it is not on the list of priorities for the next 12 months.

In the meantime, please check out these plugins:
* [Configuration Manager from Botron Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager] 
* [Project Configurator from Awnaba Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.awnaba.projectconfigurator.projectconfigurator]

on our Atlassian marketplace. 

Both of these plugins are available for the downloaded instances of JIRA and solve the use cases outlined in this requirement.

While we will not be addressing this feature in the next 12 months, we plan to resolve several other top voted feature requests in the next 12 months, including JRA-3156, JRA-3821, JRA-1431. And we have recently resolved JRA-32199, JRA-32200, JRA-2703 and JRA-7659 as well as provided the first drop of functionality related to JRA-3157.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

Currently JIRA crashes when importing workflows if referenced screens and statuses do not exist.

Jira should not need  the statuses or screens to have the same ids when importing workflows from one instance to another.

It makes it very difficult to import new workflows from a test/development instance to production. This use case is [explicitly documented |http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.6.1/workflow.html#copying_workflows].

Perhaps upon import, JIRA should ask whether to create new statuses, by default pre-filled with the workflow step name? For screens perhaps it could do something similar, or maybe remove the screens.

Either way JIRA should not crash on importing workflows at all.
fields.summary: Import workflow through XML should not rely on status and screen IDs

fields.description: Enabling attachments by drag and drop will make life much easier!
fields.summary: Enable attaching files to an issue by drag and drop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9951].
  {panel}

When I create a filter, the custom fields searchers shown depend on which issue type I have selected for the search. If the "Any" issue type is selected, only custom fields that are available in the Global context are searchable. To be able to search custom fields that are only available for specifik issue types, one of those types must be specified in a new search.

I have a setup where the Participants field (from the JIRA Toolkit Plugin) is only defined for the Bug, Improvement, New Feature and Usability (custom) Issue types. Most of the people that search the issue database are not aware of this restriction, as they generally only work with these issue types. When they search, for participants, they want to find _all_ issue with this particular participant, and therefor do not specify a specific Issue type to search. The problem is that because they do not specify one of the issue types for which the field is enabled, thay can not search the field at all.

What I miss is an option to allow all custom field searches to be shown when creating a new filter. I understand the need to limit the view if many custom fields have been defined. But when the Any issue type is selected in a new filter, a second Custom Fields section should be available that provides access to fields that only are available in for specific issue types.

I know this could probably be created as a plugin, but my company does not have the Java expertice available to do this. I also believe this would be a great addition to either JIRA itself or to the Toolkit Plugin that most people seem to have installes anyway.
fields.summary: Custom Field searchers should be accessible when the Any issue type is selected in Create New Filter
JIRA Skins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9941].
  {panel}

This is sort of similar to JRA-8514, but requesting email notifications for a different type of event.

When an issue gets a sub-task created, the people who are watching the main issue do not get an email notification. I suppose an 'issue created' event is fired, so just people associated with the new sub-task receive notification. Watchers of the parent issue get no notification.

Is there an easy workaround we could use to set up notifications like this?

Thanks,
Kim
fields.summary: new notification type for "Sub-task of issue created"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9935].
  {panel}

This could be a problem with the documentation or with the handler itself.

In our docs we have:
"When the "reporterusername" option is specified, the "from" address of the email is added at the end of the comment of the issue."

But the email is only appended to the description in the Create Issue Handler and not the Comment Handler.
fields.summary: Comment Handler documentation wrong

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9913].
  {panel}

THE BYPRODUCT OF THIS ISSUE CAN BE LOST DATA/PRODUCTIVITY

I have validated this still exists in V3.6 of JIRA running on Atlassian's site.

Hotkeys such as Alt+F (File Menu) and Alt+E (Edit Menu) in Firefox are being overridden by JIRA. My improvement suggestion is to change the JIRA hotkeys to NOT duplicate those implemented by common browsers. 

Although IE does not cause pages to switch until you activate the link (by hitting enter or the space bar), Firefox activates the link immediately and thus leaves the user with no recourse to reclaim any comments they entered.

I've lost work on several occasions and am beginning to work around by typing in notepad first, but I am confident designers of JIRA would agree that this shouldn't be necessary especially when Alt+e then a is a very common shortcut for the Edit-Select All implementation in software.

I understand that not all users may experience the Alt+e problem since not all users have rights to edit JIRA issues. But the Alt-F feature (use the File menu) would also be overridden to the Find link in JIRA. ( just validated this and gladly cut my content to the clipboard before trying since all was lost hitting alt+F)

Another JIRA requested for a feature which allows the user to decide whether they want to be diverted from the edit mode they were in might be one approach, though could also be irritating as the "do you really want to delete the file" found in windows explorer but i digress.
fields.summary: JIRA Hotkeys duplicate browser Menu hotkeys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9910].
  {panel}

Our JIRA users are requesting a feature that would automatically add a pre-defined list of people as watchers to each issue they create. Specifically, their manager has requested to be a watcher for each issue they create.

Example
When user-a creates an issue, they want manager-a to automatically be a watcher.
When user-b creates an issue, they want manager-b and manager-c to automatically be watchers.

This could either be configured...

...through the profile of user-a, saying that they want manager-a to be a watcher on all issue they create in any project.

and/or

...through the profile of manager-a, with a special permission, saying that they want to be a watcher on all issues created by user-a in any project.
fields.summary: Default watchers per reporter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9896].
  {panel}

Some users would like to create a new option value in an already present custom field (eg. select list, multi-select list). 

A use case for this would be a custom field select list that is a 'build number':

* Create a new build number option as part of the Jelly script or SOAP service.
* Create a group of issues via Jelly or SOAP that has this new build number selected.
fields.summary: Allow the addition of option values to custom fields in Jelly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9836].
  {panel}

It would be great to be able to get a permalink to the current view you have in Jira (excluding personal portlets). 

i.e. if there was a "permalink" item next to the Print icon you could send what you are looking at to other people. Currently you cannot do this by copying links because they do not include all the parameters used to construct the view.

Also, as a side effect, this would mean you could fix the Print icon so it did the same and you could bookmark or send links to printable content.

This issue is a superset of JRA-7817
fields.summary: Permalinks for all views i.e. project Roadmap, personal Roadmap etc
Roadmap is diffecult to see the difference between open and closed issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9826].
  {panel}

Occasionally one wishes to query JIRA by the date a certain field last changed.  For example, to find:
 - issues where a work log was entered in the last month. 
 - issues whose fix-for version was set in the last month.
 - issues whose due date was set in the last month

If we could further specify _what value_ the field had to be before considering the date, we could search for issues *resolved* in the last month, aka Resolution Date ("issues where status became 'resolved' in the last month").
fields.summary: Search by date a field was last updated (eg. "issues with work logged in last week")
Would be "visually" beneficial if all references to  "Due"  (ie the Due Date in JIRA) were in a larger font size and bold and red (so that it stands out)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9816].
  {panel}

RSS Feeds should send a 304 HTTP status and an empty body when the client sends an 'If-Modified-Since' header and the feed has not changed since the time specified.

Used technique defined in RFC2616 for sending the correct string for the If-Modified-Since header:

  To get best results when sending an If-Modified-Since header field
  for cache validation, clients are advised to use the exact date 
  string received in a previous Last-Modified header field whenever 
  possible.

Currently, JIRA always seems to send a 200 OK and the RSS feed as its body.

Filed this issue under Issue navigator because the RSS GET URL contains a call to IssueNavigator.jspa.
fields.summary: RSS Feeds should contain status code 304 when content has not changed
Add a multiple level group by report
Please add the "Due Date" in the JIRA report titled: "Single Level Group By Report"
Enhance our cvs integration to allow for the setting of the cvs log encoding
A why-not button for bulk-change operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9728].
  {panel}

While writing tooling to integrate our development process with our Jira installation I found the javadoc to be non-existant for the exposed APIs.

Example:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html#addVersion(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteVersion)

Even if you don't document any of your other code I would expect to see documentation in any form of remoting service you offer on your product. It took quite some searching to find out that a sequence of -1 puts a version at the top of the roadmap.
fields.summary: Poor javadoc in the exposed API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9692].
  {panel}

We quite often have people asking why a Custom Field is not being shown in the Issue Navigator (columns and search bar).
It is because they have not narrowed down the context correctly.

At the top of the _Custom Field_ Section, can we place include a message: *Not all fields are shown due to [Context|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_filters.html#multi_project].  Please narrow Project or Issue Type selection*.

or something similar...

Add ability to mark versions as major or minor - for use in reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9674].
  {panel}

I think the support request feature is great, but it shifts the conversation to email and away from where it belongs:  In an issue tracker like JIRA!

Here's how I think it should (ideally) work:

1) It should create an issue within the local JIRA
  - this implies you'd have to be able to set all of the things you would set for a regular issue, such as issue type, summary, security level, priority, etc...
  - it could also optionally imply that JIRA should ship by default with a project for tracking issues related to JIRA itself (I can't imagine anyone not doing this, but I suppose it's no big deal for folks to create their own)
2) The issue should be assigned to the user with the email address the support request is being sent to.  If one does not exist yet, it should be created (perhaps the system should get a username and description  -- aka full name in that case)
3) The issue would have the backup and log attached just as the email does.  The local environment might be good as an attachment as well -- it takes up a lot of room on the screen
4) On the atlassian end, the email should be imported into an issue at support.atlassian.com

Why keep it in both places, you ask?  Because until there's a portlet for watching issues on someone else's JIRA, most of us will only pay attention to what's in our own JIRA and it doesn't make sense for Atlassian to deal with support requests on everyone else's JIRAs.


Note that I've already implemented a workaround that works pretty well for me (see JRA-9547) and you'd have to deal with potential notification loops between the two JIRAs (see JRA-9617).
fields.summary: Support  Request feature should be more tightly integrated
Integrity checker should validate uniqueness of IDs across OSCurrentStep and OSHistoryStep.
Add URL parameters to URL in AccessLogFilter
Display input errors from validators inline on create issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9634].
  {panel}

jira does not appear to have an ability to control the types of object a specifi relationship type can attach to.

If this could be done then the UI would be improved 
   less choices to get wrong in the dropdown
   better filetring of the choices to relate to in the helper screens

Also the relationship data is likely to be more accurate, as the user is guided thorugh selection of the relationships thatthe designer thinks are appropriate
fields.summary: Add ability to restrict issue types of issues for a issue link type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9631].
  {panel}

It would be nice to enable the following options in the Find Issues critera:

[x]  Changed or commented by (user picker with default: the Current User)

(and if the current user was the only option, it'd be less flexible but OK in most cases for me) 

That way I could have a pre-fab filter for "find all modified by or /commented on by me in the last 30 days" or do a custom search for something like: title contains "weblogic" and was commented on by me (with no date range).
fields.summary: Add search criteria option for "Changed or Commented By Me"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9624].
  {panel}

It would be nice if filters, as well as gadgets, could be specified with a "current project" value for the Project selection, and allow a dashboard to be associated with a project. Thus, you could:
- create one dashboard with many gadgets, some of them being based on filters, and then duplicated that dashboard for each project and simply change the associated project, without having to edit every single gadget and, even worse, recreating the filters so that they apply to the new project
- create generic fitlers whose output would depend on the current project (there is a notion of current project in Jira - for instance, when you click on Browse Project or when you do a quick search bug issue number)
- reports could also be generic, instead of forcing you to create a new filter for each project
fields.summary: Make use of the "current project" in filters and gadgets
Quickselect of recently used watchers

fields.description:

The caller column of the tables {{OS_CURRENTSTEP}} and {{OS_HISTORYSTEP}} should be the user who made the transition into the step or created the issue.

When a user creates an issue (regardless of who is placed in the reporter field), the caller should be the current remote user.
When a user transitions an issue, the above step goes into the history with the caller untouched, and the new entry in the Current table has the current remote user in the caller field.

Workflow scheme change..... admin who does the change? the previous user?  some system user..

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9587].
  {panel}

If you try running the jelly service new line characters are ignored.

A workaround is to use jelly variables. For example:
{code:xml}
<core:set> var="description">
This is a test
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
</core:set>
<jira:CreateIssue description="${description}"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Jelly Service ignores new line characters
Copy option for admin->services

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9567].
  {panel}

Hi!

I would like to request a new feature for JIRA: a SyncML server.

With a SyncML interface it would be possible to sync JIRA issues with
the task list of an electronic calendar or PDA / PIM application.

This would increase productivity in areas where employees use both
systems as their task lists could be updated automatically.

JIRA should name its tasks uniqely, so that it only syncs JIRA tasks and
not additional ones created by the user in their calendar task list.

Is such an interface possible?
fields.summary: SyncML integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9559].
  {panel}

A customer has requested that we add support for the Apache Authentication Scheme. 

Bugzilla can currently do this too as noted in their 2.20.1 release notes:

http://www.bugzilla.org/releases/2.20.1/release-notes.html:

"Environment Variable" Authentication Method --------------------------------------------  You can now tell Bugzilla to accept a certain value passed in from Apache as authentication for Bugzilla users. This means that Bugzilla now "supports" any type of authentication that Apache supports.
fields.summary: Add support for Apache authentication scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9557].
  {panel}

For the datetime picker, Jira does not format the am and pm.

This means that in a language like Japanese the date time picker does not work.

For example Jira willl produce

*30/3月/06 12:39 PM* when it needs *30/3月/06 12:39 午前*

A quick workaround here is to use 24-hour time. To do this:
# Goto WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties
# Edit the date picker format lines to look like below:
{code}
jira.date.time.picker.java.format = dd/MMM/yy HH:mm
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format = %e/%b/%y %H:%M
{code}
# Restart Jira
fields.summary: Date Time Picker has incorrect formatting fro Japanese

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9554].
  {panel}

A custom has requested the ability to allow workflow paths to be based on specific field values. 

This would be made possible based on:

1) issue creation where specific field values would dictate the initial workflow status the issue was placed in upon creation; and
2) field value specified during workflow transition screen.

So depending on the field values the issue would move to the appropriate workflow status as configured by the user in a custom workflow.
fields.summary: Create custom workflow elements to action specific transition based on specific field value
Allow specific users to be notified based on specific field values
Create workflow post-function that notifies a specific user based on custom field value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9533].
  {panel}

Currently each JIRA issue has a change log associated with it,  which displays the Field change information (ie. Status, Assignee, resolution). The change log tells which field has changed, when was it changed, what was the old value and what is the new value. Is this change log available via the SOAP API? 

For instance we have opened an issue LEH-1 and the status is Open.  After a week the issue status changed to Closed.  We need timestamps when such transitions occur. The issue might have been commented a number of times before and after it was closed. We dont need these intermediate timestamps.

LEH-1
Opened --------- March 2 16.30 2006
Say it was commented ------ March 3 16.30 2006
Closed---------------- March 6 16.30 2006
Commented---------March 7 16.30 2006

Our interest would be in dates when the issue status changes. (i.e. open<------->progress/close /[all other statuses]). Would it be possible to provide a  API for this information?


Can this be implemented in your next future JIRA release?
fields.summary: Add ability to retrieve change log and status change dates via the SOAP API
group projects by category in CreateNewIssue
Vcs Update Service rlog import shouldn't have to pull the whole log every time
Suppress notifications on issue updates
Add javadoc to SearchParameter classes.

In fact, we have many users from others countries and they don't want to see their first connection in our defaut language and they don't want to have to change their preferences.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9478].
  {panel}

At the moment the JIRA-API does not allow to create new security levels or add an existing user group to a security level. In class com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueLevelSecurities you can delete levels and clear user level.  Currently there is only the way through com.atlassian.jira.jelly.tag.admin.enterprise.AddIssueSecurityLevel by using the jelly class what is quite cumbersome and I think using this class is not the generic way to create new security levels .
Perhaps this functionality could be added in one of the upcoming releases ?
Best
Franz
fields.summary: Enlarge API for IssueSecurityLevels to be able to create a new security level and add a user group to a security level.
Components should have a URL just like the project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

This is from a user:
Recently I remarked that it would be nice if Jira standalone setup  could just import instead of requiring a setup first and then an import.
I don't know if this has been there for a long time (or always) but I  notice 3.5.1 has this - it's just not quite as obvious as it could be.
Score 1 Atlassian!
I would however add a new initial screen - with two clear choices  "Setup a new Jira installation" and "Import existing Jira data"
Make it really obvious for us people who are in too much of a hurry  to read the fine print properly
fields.summary: It would be nice if JIRA started with two clear choices  "Setup a new Jira installation" and "Import existing Jira data"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9457].
  {panel}

This new feature request is about a more effective interface to let you perform bulk operations on bugs, with more resolution than changing the same field(s) on every bug to the same thing. Let's call it a "mass" operation instead of "bulk".

Consider this scenario: you are doing triage on a set of open bugs - reprioritizing, potentially reassigning, setting due dates and versions, perhaps resolving as "postponed". This triage could be daily, or it could be the result of a change in schedule or feature set that makes you need to revisit a bunch of them. Now, as a producer or dev lead or whatever, you're very familiar with most of these bugs, so a glance at the Summary field in the Issue Navigator is usually enough to let you know what's going on.

I don't know about everyone else who uses Jira, but for my team this is a really common scenario. Anyway, right now you have two options to do your mass update:

  1. Go through every bug one at a time and do the combination of edits, and workflow transitions required.
  2. Subdivide bulk edits based on type - so do all setting-to-pri-1 in one pass, setting-to-pri-2 in another pass, reassigning-to-Bob in another pass...

Both of these are really tedious and it makes it really hard to go through a lot of bugs and update them very quickly, to the point that we don't do it nearly as often as we should. I've got a proposal for this.

-----

Proposal:

Have a new "mass edit" feature that is similar to Step 1 of Bulk Operation: an Issue Navigator style grid, except instead of each field being static, have it be editable. If it's a priority field, say, it would become a drop-down of all priorities, with the current priority for that bug selected, rather than static text. If it's the Assignee field, it would become a drop-down of all available people to assign to (with the current assignee selected), and so on. There should also be a previous step to Mass Edit that lets you choose which fields appear in this grid, so what's visible is only what you want to change.

In addition, have a column at the end (enabled via that "previous step" I just mentioned) that lets you select possible workflow transitions, again via a drop-down (defaulting to "leave as-is") that shows all possible transitions for each bug - the same list as would appear in the "Operations" section on the left bar if you were to be viewing that individual bug.

The "next" step would confirm the changes that are proposed, and then a "next" after that to commit them. First it would do the edit updates, then it would do the workflow transitions. Perhaps it would give you a button to continue working with the bugs that had workflow transitions, in case you wanted to send them through further transitions (i.e. go back to step 1).

Maybe a better name for this feature would be Grid Mass Edit or something. Some other bugbases have this feature (such as Microsoft's RAID) and it's extremely useful for working quickly through a set of bugs.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit + per-bug edit ability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9439].
  {panel}

Dear I think there is missing some function that will help to customize workflow and I think this will resolve also a lot of queries from users like this JRA-4812.
Please could it be possible to add the INITIALIZATION part between the CONDITIONS and VALIDATORS parts?
This is on the View Workflow Transition page, where you can add some conditions, validators and post functions.
This is the same way but there will be possible to add some plugins to initialize the issue when the transition is started.
This will be very usefull for default values of any filed on the screen that is associated with transition.
Also this can be usefull for create (initial) transition where then will be possible to initialize any filed before the form is populated to the user.
Also there will be possible to change requireness of any filed for the current transition.
And lastly there will be possible to run any plugin that will be created before the transition is started.

This actions is not possible to do by Conditions or by Validators because this is exatly between it.
Thank you for answer.
Best Regards
fields.summary: Add Initialization to the transitions of workflow
"Change Assign To" sounds weird

Allow configuring colour of company banner in Look and Feel section
Active directory login problem
Create a workflow post-function to allow dynamic time tracking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9401].
  {panel}

We need to subscribe specific users to all/selected notifications on specific notifications. In our organization, we have ~20 teams which is why we need that different users subscribe for different projects, while notification scheme need to be the same (as it's unreal to manage 20 schemes which differ only in single specific user on some event types.

Both user-initiated and adminstrator-set subcription would suffice.

Examples of subscriptions we have are:
- project manager AND lead developer, on their project (PM <> lead dev are different people, and frequenly they both need to stay tuned)
- senior project manager, on projects of his category (each senior mentors his own category)
- head of development, on selected projects he mentors
- mailing list of specific project

Ability to select notification types would be nice to have, but it's ok to start with "all or nothing" option in our case.
fields.summary: project-level subscribe specific user within single notification scheme
Show configured navigator columns in text email subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9380].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 3 December 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all!

My name is Jonno and I’m a PM on the editing experience in Jira Cloud (including Jira Software and Jira Service Management). Thanks for all this feedback. Given the level of interest we’ve conducted some research to reassess the link click behaviour across Jira Cloud and our other products like Confluence Cloud that use our new editing experience.

+*Decision:*+

Based off our research, *we will keep the existing default behaviour.*

This existing default behaviour is:
 * All links in the editor (i.e. the mode where you can see a toolbar and insert content) will open in a new tab by default.

 * All links in the renderer (i.e. the published/saved view of an issue description, comment, etc) will open in the same tab by default.

+*Reasoning:*+

We assessed multiple approaches and landed on keeping the existing behaviour for the following reasons.

For users in the editor:
 * We don’t want a user to be moved away from the current work they’re doing so open the link in a new tab by default. This is common behaviour.

For users in the renderer:
 * Common link-click behaviour on the web is to open in the same tab.

 * If we open links in a new tab by default, it’s impossible for a user to open the link in the same tab. For opening in same tab by default, however, there are common ways to open in a new tab, like cmd + click (Mac), ctrl + click (Windows & Linux), right click then select open link in new tab, or pressing the middle button on a mouse.

 * From an accessibility standpoint it is better to stick with the default browser behaviour and open links in the same tab. The main arguments for this are:
 ** Assistive technology users can become disoriented when a link opens a new tab or window. They cannot use the back button to return to their previous location. We want to minimize this as much as possible. We have a toolbar button for opening links in the editor to give those with accessibility needs guidance that a new tab is opening.
 ** People with mobility or dexterity issues who rely on a keyboard may find it difficult or painful to perform additional navigation tasks.

 

For both the renderer and editor:
 * We decided against giving user-level control of how their links open when clicked. Aside from the accessibility and other reasons mentioned above, we believe this could cause confusion to consumers of the content. This is because every link could hypothetically open in a different way. It wouldn’t afford the consumer of the content a predictable experience when clicking on a link.

*Next steps:*

I know this won’t be the decision a number of you are looking for, and I’m sorry for that. It’s what we believe is the best decision, for the majority of our user base, with the current information we have at our disposal.

Based off this decision, I’ll be closing this ticket and marking it as “Closed”.

We’re always looking to reassess and improve our experiences. If new information comes to light that suggests we should iterate this approach, we’ll definitely reconsider.

Thanks again for your feedback.

Jonno | PM, Atlassian Cloud Editor
{panel}
Some users need to have external links in Description / Comments to open in new browser window.
 Looks like this should be per-user configurable.

*Workaround*
 Use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac.
fields.summary: external links to open in new window
Implement a Release History which allows a user to view a timeline of issues getting added and removed from a release
Add Resolve and Next and Close and Next buttons to Resolve Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9367].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 28 July 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your patience. We are happy to communicate that this issue is closed as fixed, and it will be available to you shortly.

As you might have noticed, we have not planned this improvement to be addressed explicitly. But we have discovered that we can close it quite easily as a consequence of architectural work delivered to close JRA-25721.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

Custom fields which are issue type or project specific are not shown in the issue navigator until the relevant project or issue type is selected (and refreshed via the blue box). This could potentially be a bit confusing for first time users.
fields.summary: Custom Fields Visibility in the Issue Navigator
More date support for migrating using Jelly
